definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Don't waste your time. Don't you know he's square?
sentences.chinese: 別浪費你的時間了，你不知道他是個老古板嗎？

sentences.english: You have worked at the same job for a year and people call you an "old-timer".
sentences.chinese: 朋友們叫你“老古板”，因爲你在一個地方幹了一年。

sentences.english: My neighbor is a real stick-in-the-mud, and he's only thirty-two.
sentences.chinese: 我的鄰居是個老古板，而且他才三十二歲。

sentences.english: Yeah, my boss is a real stiff.

definition: to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
unable to understand/can't get the point
